text: Austerity Britain now has one of the lowest levels of public spending in Europe (close to the US’s 36% of GDP).
author: georgeeaton

text: One of the ironic consequences of Brexit has been to create a Europhile movement that the UK previously lacked.
author: georgeeaton

text: Enjoyed talking to @JoanaRamiroUK about the rebirth of the left, the future of the media and my decade at the NS. #redhacks
author: georgeeaton

text: And @sjwrenlewis on the moral and economic case for funding a #GreenNewDeal through government debt. 3/3
author: georgeeaton

text: .@paulmasonnews on why Ocasio-Cortez's #GreenNewDeal is "a landmark in the politics of this century". 2/3
author: georgeeaton

text: Some of the best recent @NewStatesman pieces on #GreenNewDeal: @graceblakeley on why the UK needs an economic transformation regardless of the Brexit outcome. 1/3
author: georgeeaton

text: How Australia incubated far-right terror — essential piece by @timsout on how the politics of hate moved from the fringe to the mainstream and how to fight it.
author: georgeeaton

text: Clement Attlee, of course, described referendums as "a device of dictators and demagogues" and said "I could not consent to the introduction into our national life of a device so alien to all our traditions". 2/2
author: georgeeaton

text: The logic of Theresa May's demagogic separation between "the people" and parliament would be to hold a referendum on her deal vs. no deal. 1/2
author: georgeeaton

text: Nice, congrats! (My alma mater.)
author: georgeeaton

text: David Hare excoriates Cameron and Osborne in this week's @NewStatesman: "Byron burgers in hand, two privileged public schoolboys shredded received notions of social justice. Rather more seriously, they also made millions of people needlessly poor."
author: georgeeaton

text: A particularly remarkable extract from May’s “nasty party” speech: “Some Tories have tried to make political capital by demonising minorities instead of showing confidence in all the citizens of our country.”
author: georgeeaton

text: These lines could be a critique of her entire leadership: “Our base is too narrow and so, occasionally, are our sympathies, You know what some people call us: the nasty party.”
author: georgeeaton

text: Every so often I remember that Theresa May gave the “nasty party” speech in 2002 and I shudder with cognitive dissonance. 1/2
author: georgeeaton

text: Reminded, as ever, that @ameliargh has one of the best handles on this place.
author: georgeeaton

text: How veganism moved from the fringe to the mainstream - fascinating long read by @ameliargh.
author: georgeeaton

text: We’re waiting to hear what the EU27 have decided the UK’s fate should be - not taking back control but losing it.
author: georgeeaton

text: Theresa May's Trumpian speech was reminiscent of a sovereign dictator — must-read piece by @lea_ypi on the theory May's words evoked.
author: georgeeaton

text: Often forgotten that when the EU created Article 50 they never thought any country would be so reckless as to use it — Brussels is judge, jury and executioner. https://www.newstatesman.com/politics/uk/2019/03/brexit-has-allowed-eu-take-back-control-over-uk …
author: georgeeaton

text: Blistering polemic by @yanisvaroufakis against all sides: "Bitterness and self-resentment ooze out of both left-wing and right-wing Brexiteers but, equally, out of the shrinking 'radical' centre."
author: georgeeaton

text: The perils of EU membership, universal open borders and how capitalism will end - fascinating interview with Wolfgang Streeck by @hettieveronica.
author: georgeeaton

text: He emphasises: "If it takes a second referendum to defeat it, that option should be taken."
author: georgeeaton

text: Theresa May's Brexit deal would be disastrous for a future left government — Remain is unambiguously better, writes John McDonnell's former economic adviser @meadwaj. https://www.newstatesman.com/politics/economy/2019/03/theresa-mays-brexit-deal-would-be-disastrous-future-left-government …
author: georgeeaton

text: Thanks Nessa, much appreciated.
author: georgeeaton

text: Thanks Mark, appreciated.
author: georgeeaton

text: Thanks Dan, much appreciated.
author: georgeeaton

text: Thanks Mathew, much appreciated!
author: georgeeaton

text: Apocalypse Now: reviewing tomorrow’s papers on @BBCNews with @katyballs at 10:35pm + 11:30pm. #tomorrowspaperstoday
author: georgeeaton

text: The great irony of Brexit: the EU has taken back control from the UK.
author: georgeeaton

text: Based on that, Theresa May’s understanding of charm offensive doesn’t extend beyond offensive.
author: georgeeaton

text: "There is no good reason why the government should pay private companies to hire people to hire other people to deliver government contracts." Excellent piece from @graceblakeley on the UK's broken outsourcing model.
author: georgeeaton

text: Thanks Owain, much appreciated.
author: georgeeaton

text: Plus, @hettieveronica’s interview with Wolfgang Streeck, @Anoosh_C on the curse of Love Island, @graceblakeley on the UK’s broken outsourcing model and @ameliargh on how veganism went mainstream. 2/2
author: georgeeaton

text: Tomorrow’s NS, a special issue on the crisis featuring @yanisvaroufakis, @stephenkb, David Hare, @Elif_Safak, @dmiliband and Rowan Williams. 1/2
author: georgeeaton

text: The UK's fate is now dependent on the whim of governments including far-right Hungary and Italy — one of the most humiliating moments in post-war history. https://www.newstatesman.com/politics/uk/2019/03/brexit-has-allowed-eu-take-back-control-over-uk …
author: georgeeaton

text: Thanks Hamza, much appreciated.
author: georgeeaton

text: The great irony of Brexit is that it has given the EU more control over the UK than ever before. https://www.newstatesman.com/politics/uk/2019/03/brexit-has-allowed-eu-take-back-control-over-uk …
author: georgeeaton

text: Brexit has allowed the EU to take back control over the UK — my piece on the humiliation of the UK begging for an Article 50 extension. https://www.newstatesman.com/politics/uk/2019/03/brexit-has-allowed-eu-take-back-control-over-uk …
author: georgeeaton

text: A perfect example of the sunk cost fallacy.
author: georgeeaton

text: The strongest argument against Brexit has proved to be Brexit.
author: georgeeaton

text: Brexiteers are stopping Brexit because they need to believe in the fantasy of "Global Britain" — typically insightful piece by @sjwrenlewis.
author: georgeeaton

text: It was Theresa May, not John Bercow, who torpedoed her Brexit deal in June 2017. As @patrickkmaguire explains here, lack of a parliamentary majority is the biggest problem, not Bercow.
author: georgeeaton

text: Leavers dislike repeated votes (except when it suits them). Remainers dislike referendums (except when it suits them).
author: georgeeaton

text: Missed opportunity to point out to liberal optimist Steven Pinker that life expectancy is falling in the UK and income inequality is rising. #r4today
author: georgeeaton

text: Labour's democratic socialists have nothing to fear from debate with internal rivals, writes shadow cabinet minister and Corbyn ally @jon_trickett in response to Tom Watson's new group.
author: georgeeaton

text: The comically dismal Brexit march reminds me of this from Orwell’s The Lion and the Unicorn: “In England all the boasting and flag-wagging, the ‘Rule Britannia’ stuff, is done by small minorities.”
author: georgeeaton

text: See my second tweet.
author: georgeeaton

text: All the more so because Khan defied an Islamophobic campaign to win. He has always presented himself as a mayor who happens to be a Muslim, rather than a Muslim mayor, but his presence at moments like this is undeniably powerful. 2/2
author: georgeeaton

text: That London elected a Muslim mayor - in a new era of far-right terror and politics - should be an enduring source of pride to the city. 1/2
author: georgeeaton

text: I see on a later edition this was amended to “little boy”.
author: georgeeaton

text: In what respect?
author: georgeeaton

text: Sorry? What’s your objection?
author: georgeeaton

text: Indeed, that’s precisely my point.
author: georgeeaton

text: And then first sentence asks how “hard-working fitness trainer” was “turned” as if people with those qualities are more moral than others.
author: georgeeaton

text: Absurd front page. Would it be more explicable if he was a “devil child”?
author: georgeeaton
